  • Method Details

    • giveItem

      public static void giveItem(net.minecraft.world.entity.player.Player player, net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack stack)
      Gives the player an item. If it can't be given directly, it spawns an EntityItem. Spawns 1 block above player's feet.
      Parameters:
      player - The player
      stack - The item

    • removeItem

      public static void removeItem(net.minecraft.world.entity.player.Player player, net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack stack)
      Removes the stack from the player's inventory, if it exists.
      Parameters:
      player - The player
      stack - The item

    • getPersistedDataSubcompound

      public static net.minecraft.nbt.CompoundTag getPersistedDataSubcompound(net.minecraft.world.entity.player.Player player, String subCompoundKey)
      Gets a tag compound from the player's persisted data NBT compound, or creates it if it does not exist. This can be used to save additional data to a player.
      Parameters:
      player - The player
      subCompoundKey - The key for the tag compound (ideally should contain mod ID)
      Returns:
      The tag compound, creating it if it does not exist.

    • getFirstValidStack

      @Nonnull public static net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack getFirstValidStack(net.minecraft.world.entity.player.Player player, boolean includeMain, boolean includeOffHand, boolean includeArmor, Predicate<net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack> predicate)
      Gets the first matching valid ItemStack in the players inventory.
      Parameters:
      player - The player
      includeMain - Search the players main inventory (hotbar and the 3 rows above that, hotbar is first, I think).
      includeOffHand - Check the player's offhand slot as well.
      includeArmor - Check the player's armor slots as well.
      predicate - The condition to check for on the ItemStack.
      Returns:
      The first ItemStack that matches the predicate, or ItemStack.EMPTY if there is no match. Search order is offHand, armor, main.
      Since:
      2.3.1
